definition[0]: if a place is tucked away, it is in a quiet area
example[0]: The village of Eyam is tucked away behind the hills.
definition[1]: if someone or something is tucked away, they are hidden or difficult to find
example[1]: The envelope was tucked away in her jewel box.
definition[2]: to store something, especially money, in a safe place
example[2]: Every member of the family can now tuck away either £9 or £18 a month in one of these savings plans.
definition[3]: to eat a lot of food, usually quickly and with enjoyment
